      public Float[] calculateParameterGradients(Float[] inputs)
      Description copied from interface: TrainableScalarFunction
      Calculates the parameterGradients of the scalar function with respect to its trainable parameters, given the input values.
      Specified by:
      calculateParameterGradients in interface TrainableScalarFunction<Float>
      Parameters:
      inputs - the input feature vector to the function
      Returns:
      an array of partial derivatives ∂f/∂θ_k for each parameter θ_k

    • arity

      public int arity()
      Description copied from interface: EstimationFunction
      Returns the arity of this function, i.e. the number of inputs (independent variables or features) it expects.

      For example:

      • A univariate function f(x) has arity 1.
      • A multivariate function f(x, y, z) has arity 3.
      • In machine learning, this corresponds to the input feature dimension.
      Specified by:
      arity in interface EstimationFunction<Float>
      Returns:
      the number of inputs (arity) this function accepts
